p: The study at hand assumes the urban form to be constant in time. As such, the mortality figures for the future time periods provide results for an unadapted city. Mortalities in well-adapted cities will probably be lower, as other studies have indicated that the negative effects of climate warming can be reduced by urban adaptation [ 56]. On the other hand, increased urbanization can increase the magnitude of the UHI-effect and the heat-related health effects in urban agglomerations [ 57, 58].
